page.title: 19 Thorverton
page.content: Thorverton is situated in the south-west corner of our survey square. The village is smaller than Silverton with a population of about 1000. The land cover is mostly rough grazing. In the village there are two food shops and a post office. There is a primary school and three pubs; The Exeter, The Bell and The Dolphin. Some of the pubs have restaurants in them. In Thorverton there are Brownies and Venture Scouts, Cubs and Guides, a W.I. group and also the Jam club. There is a village green and a Hall where a Saturday market is held. The Surgery is run by Doctor Moxon.
